meanings.definition: The ability to soak up liquid or moisture.
meanings.sent1: The paper towel's absorbency was impressive as it quickly soaked up the spilled water.
meanings.sent2: The sponge's absorbency made cleaning up the mess much easier.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape had such incredible absorbency that it could even soak up a river!
meanings.sent4: Her absorbency for knowledge was like a sponge, always eager to learn new things.
meanings.sent5: The desert's absorbency for rain was so low that even a drop would disappear instantly.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to take in or assimilate something.
meanings.sent1: The student's absorbency of the lesson was evident in how well he answered the questions.
meanings.sent2: The absorbency of the fabric allowed the dye to penetrate evenly.
meanings.sent3: The robot's strange absorbency of emotions made it a hit at the science fair.
meanings.sent4: Her absorbency of new ideas was like a sponge, always ready to accept different perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The absorbency of the soil was so high that it quickly absorbed all the spilled fertilizer.
